item.title: Shane Nyman column: Twitter, the misunderstood gateway to the online world | Appleton Post Crescent | postcrescent.com
item.description: Column: Twitter, the misunderstood gateway to the online world: Last weekend, in the midst of an ever-popular di... http://bit.ly/q6CzFc
item.content:encoded: Column: Twitter, the misunderstood gateway to the online world: Last weekend, in the midst of an ever-popular di... http://bit.ly/q6CzFc Eavesdropping might be frowned upon, but a lot can be learned from listening in on another’s conversation. Last weekend, in the midst of an ever-popular dinnertime “So-and-so posts way too many Facebook status updates” conversation, I heard a woman in her mid-20s pose the question, “What is Twitter?” Link - Trackbacks

item.description: #DianaNyad, 61, shows ur never 2old 2go after what u want. She plans 2swim from Cuba 2Florida w/o a shark cage 7pE/4pP http://t.co/lFIUvmZ
item.content:encoded: #DianaNyad, 61, shows ur never 2old 2go after what u want. She plans 2swim from Cuba 2Florida w/o a shark cage 7pE/4pP http://t.co/lFIUvmZ Diana Nyad likes a challenge. At 61, a lot of people are considering retirement and spending time with grandchildren. Not Nyad. For nearly two years, she's been training for her 103-mile swim between Cuba and Florida. And now the adventure is about to begin. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: beta620 | Experimental Projects From The New York Times
item.description: Future of journalism is now http://t.co/bGK4mPO
item.content:encoded: Future of journalism is now http://t.co/bGK4mPO At The New York Times, our software engineers, journalists, product managers and designers are constantly striving to create new and innovative ways to present news and information and interact with our readers. Yet it's often difficult to try out new inventions on the world's largest newspaper Web site. That's why we created beta620, a new home for experimental projects from Times developers — and a place for anyone to suggest and collaborate on new ideas and new products. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: nytimes.com

item.title: 20歳を迎えた「ワールド・ワイド・ウェブ」
item.description: [New]: 20歳を迎えた「ワールド・ワイド・ウェブ」 http://bit.ly/qoeZ5P
item.content:encoded: [New]: 20歳を迎えた「ワールド・ワイド・ウェブ」 http://bit.ly/qoeZ5P 「ウェブ」の誕生から20年を迎えた。Tim Berners-Leeが世界に「ネットの愉しみ」を紹介したのがちょうど20年前なのだ。もちろん当時は「ポルノ」がこれほどまでにネットで広がるとは想定していなかったことだろう。そう。世界最初のウェブサイトは1991年8月6日、Sir Berners-Leeによって開設された。生まれたばかりのハイパーテキスト・マークアップランゲージによって記述された。そこから発展を続けたウェブはついに20歳となった。この20年間、インターネットはどのように成長していっただろうか。 Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: Daring Fireball Linked List: Seth Clifford Buys a Galaxy Tab 10.1
item.description: Seth Clifford Buys a Galaxy Tab 10.1: http://df4.us/i3o
item.content:encoded: Seth Clifford Buys a Galaxy Tab 10.1: http://df4.us/i3o Case in point: when I went to Staples, I asked the sales guy for the 10.1 and the first thing he said was “What are you buying it for?” When I replied, “development”, he said “Ok, because this thing isn’t going to replace a laptop for you”. No problem, I assured him, we’re app devs, and we know what we’re doing. Then, the manager came over to verify the coupon I had and asked the same question again. Again I replied “development” and he asked “Of what?” rather indignantly. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: daringfireball.net

item.title: Open a Bookshop, what could possibly go wrong?: North London Looting
item.description: I have written a blog about the Wood Green looting http://bit.ly/njn8Dy. Please RT if you agree.
item.content:encoded: I have written a blog about the Wood Green looting http://bit.ly/njn8Dy. Please RT if you agree. I was going to write a lovely blogpost about figuring out what book you would hate to not have in stock if you owned a bookshop, but sadly things have turned rather ugly and horrible here in North London. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: woodgreenbookshop.blogspot.com
